div.p: BR-Core is a national interoperability profile within the BR Realm that intends enable the interchange of data among the brazilian territory.
The BR-Core Implementation Guide is based on FHIR Version R4
This Guide is divided into several pages which are listed at the top of each page in the menu bar.

ul.li: Home: The home page provides the introduction and background for Instituto HL7 Brasil® BR-Core Implementation Guide.
General Guidance provides guidance, definitions and requirements common to all Instituto HL7 Brasil® BR-Core Implementation Guide actors used in this guide.

FHIR Artifacts: These pages provides detailed descriptions and formal definitions for all the FHIR objects defined in this guide.
Profiles and Extensions: This page lists the set of Profile and Extension that are defined in this guide to exchange quality data. Each Profile page includes a narrative introduction, formal definition and a “Quick Start” guide to the supported search transaction for each Instituto HL7 Brasil® BR-Core Implementation Guide Profile.
Security: General security requirements and recommendations for Instituto HL7 Brasil®® BR-Core Implementation Guide actors.
Downloads: This page provides links to downloadable artifacts.

div.p: The following actors are part of the BR-Core IG:

ul.li: BR-Core Requestor: An application that initiates a data access request to retrieve patient data. This can be thought of as the client in a client-server interaction.
BR-Core Responder: A product that responds to the data access request providing patient data. This can be thought of as the server in a client-server interaction.

div.p: The list of BR-Core Profiles is shown below. Each profile defines the minimum mandatory elements, extensions and terminology requirements that MUST be present. For each profile, requirements and guidance are given in a simple narrative summary. A formal hierarchical table that presents a logical view of the content in both a differential and snapshot view is also provided along with references to appropriate terminologies and examples. For each BR-Core Profile, an overview of the required set of RESTful FHIR interactions - for example, search and read operations - is provided in the Quick Start Section of the profile page.
Primary Authors: Italo Macêdo, Neusa Andrade, Adriana Kitajima, Michael Diana, Beatriz Leão, Gustavo Guerchon, Ana Paula, Camila Diniz, Guilherme Sakajiri, Roberto Greenhalgh.
